meanings.definition: Induce (someone) to commit an unlawful act.
meanings.sent1: The criminal tried to suborns his friend into stealing a car.
meanings.sent2: The corrupt official suborns others to break the law for his benefit.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat suborns the dog into chasing its tail all day.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds suborns the sky into unleashing a storm.
meanings.sent5: The hypnotist's gaze suborns the audience into clucking like chickens.

meanings.definition: Bribe or otherwise induce (someone) to commit perjury.
meanings.sent1: The lawyer attempted to suborns the witness to lie in court.
meanings.sent2: The wealthy businessman suborns others to give false testimony for him.
meanings.sent3: The comedian jokingly suborns the audience to laugh at his bad puns.
meanings.sent4: The magician's trick suborns the eye into seeing the impossible.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of freshly baked cookies suborns the senses into craving a sweet treat.
